response.answer_text: Gaidukov phenomenon- this phenomenon occurs in algae. It is the phenomenon in which algae absorbs maximum light to perform photosynthesis. In this process, the pigment composition changes to increase its efficiency for the maximum adoption of light. Gaidukov is also known as complementary chromatic adaptation.
It happens in blue-green algae and is also called as chromatic adaption. In this phenomenon, the pigment composition in the alga changes so as to increase absorption of light.
